articles.title: Why spend $170m to be elected as governor of Illinois? - The Economist
articles.description: The Economist Why spend $170m to be elected as governor of Illinois? The Economist “AWESOME, JUST awesome; you're the best; love that.” J.B. Pritzker dishes out quick-fire pleasantries to supporters in a hall usually reserved for Taekwondo in northern Chicago…
articles.content: AWESOME, JUST awesome; youre the best; love that. J.B. Pritzker dishes out quick-fire pleasantries to supporters in a hall usually reserved for Taekwondo in northern Chicago. Casual in baggy trousers and a woollen top, he pats backs and grins for selfies. He … [+5162 chars]

articles.title: John Magufuli is fostering a climate of fear in Tanzania
articles.description: P AUL MAKONDA seems a lot more like a flailing moral crusader than the regional commissioner of Dar es Salaam, Tanzania’s commercial capital. The 36-year-old has come up with a variety of schemes to catch the eye of his patron, President John Magufuli. One is…

articles.title: Farewell, “Big Brother”
articles.description: After 18 years, 45 series and 1,352 days’ worth of television, the British iteration of the reality show is being evicted from the schedule

articles.title: Icelandair and WOW announce a merger
articles.description: The tie-up between Iceland’s two biggest airlines is a big gamble
articles.content: THE ANNOUNCEMENT on November 5th that Icelandair and WOW, two Icelandic airlines, will merge will come as some relief to many travellers. The Icelandic flag carrier and its low-cost competitor both specialised in selling budget flights across the Atlantic, vi… [+2006 chars]

articles.title: Will Democrats’ fundraising edge help them flip the House?
articles.description: In some competitive districts Democratic candidates have vastly out-raised their opponents
articles.content: FOR the past two years, Democratic fundraisers have been engaged in an unprecedented fundraising effort. Fortunately for then, Donald Trumps presidency has become an unrivalled motivator for disaffected voters to donate to political campaigns. By the time thi… [+2951 chars]

articles.title: What happened to liberation theology?
articles.description: Its tenets have become accepted by the Catholic Church at the same time as Catholic influence is waning

articles.description: After the troubles of its ARJ21 and C919 aircraft programmes, China tries cheating instead
articles.content: AIRLINES HAVE remarkably little choice about where to buy their airliners. The global market for big civil aircraft is dominated by two firms: Boeing of America and Airbus of Europe. China has long dreamed of breaking their stranglehold, and will be showing o… [+4135 chars]

articles.title: Why don’t Latinos vote?
articles.description: Individual choices and political targeting decrease Hispanic voting and prevent Democrats from realising big gains
